title: About
text:
I’m Daniel Regalado Cardoso, a Data Scientist and AI/ML Engineer originally from Guatemala, currently based in Coral Gables, FL. I’m pursuing a Master of Science in Business Analytics at the University of Miami Herbert Business School, where I maintain a 3.9 GPA.
My journey spans chemical engineering, energy management, and now data science & AI — giving me a unique perspective that bridges technical depth with business strategy.

title: About
text:
Technical Skills

Programming & Data
Python (pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn), SQL, R, Snowflake, Databricks


Machine Learning & AI
Supervised Learning, Deep Learning, Neural Networks, Feature Engineering, LLMs, RAG, Multi-Agent Systems, NLP, Time Series (ARIMA), Embeddings, Prompt Engineering


Analytics & Visualization
Power BI, Tableau, Advanced Excel, Statistical Analysis, Data Visualization, A/B Testing


AI & Cloud Tools
LangChain, LangGraph, LangSmith, OpenAI API, Anthropic Claude, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), ChromaDB, Hugging Face, MLflow, Docker, Git

English (Fluent) · Spanish (Native)

title: Projects
text:
Sep 2025 – Present
Built a multi-agent LLM chatbot using LangGraph, LangChain, and GPT-4 Turbo to automate patient scheduling across 100+ providers. The system implements:

Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) with ChromaDB for provider knowledge
Deterministic safety gates to ensure scheduling accuracy
Confidence scoring for intelligent fallback routing
Real-time monitoring via LangSmith

LangGraph LangChain GPT-4 Turbo RAG ChromaDB LangSmith

title: Projects
section: Deloitte — AI for Equitable Public Transportation
text:
Deloitte — AI for Equitable Public Transportation
Jan 2026 – Present
Building predictive models to identify transit gaps and promote equitable public transportation access:

Regression and time series forecasting (ARIMA) using Census, GTFS, and accessibility data
Simulation models for scenario planning
Interactive dashboard for equity-driven recommendations to policymakers

Python ARIMA Time Series Census Data GTFS Dashboard
